bug.short_desc: Ability to demote/promote multiple chapters at once in writer explorer

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: The writer explorer (F5) is a great feature of libre office but when one want to promote or demote a level of several chapters at once, there is a lot of clicking required. It would be really nice if it was possible to shift-click all the chapters I wanted to demote and then just clicking "demote level" once.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): libreoffice-4.2.5.2-6.fc20.x86_64

If you would still like to see this bug fixed and are able to reproduce it against a later version of Fedora, you are encouraged change the 'version' to a later Fedora version prior this bug is closed as described in the policy above.
Although we aim to fix as many bugs as possible during every release's lifetime, sometimes those efforts are overtaken by events. Often a more recent Fedora release includes newer upstream software that fixes bugs or makes them obsolete.

Fedora 20 changed to end-of-life (EOL) status on 2015-06-23. Fedora 20 is no longer maintained, which means that it will not receive any further security or bug fix updates. As a result we are closing this bug.
If you can reproduce this bug against a currently maintained version of Fedora please feel free to reopen this bug against that version. If you are unable to reopen this bug, please file a new report against the current release. If you experience problems, please add a comment to this bug.
Thank you for reporting this bug and we are sorry it could not be fixed.
Would still be a nice-to-have feature, not there in libreoffice-5.0.3.2-11.fc23

there was an upstream bug too, 54834
finally i've had some time to implement this feature: master commit bf7b5ee0c8a552625b80a7a57c32fe05ee756f7a libreoffice-5-3 commit 946684ab33e51140f257cf497ad8c26ff4156669
however it looks like the dialog has had some rather large non-functional code changes since 5.2 that also have introduced at least one regression so i'm rather dis-inclined to backport the new feature to 5.2 / Fedora 25 but Fedora 26 should get it in time so CLOSED NEXTRELEASE.
